result.execSummary:
The defendant Deke D. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deke D. Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deke D. Miller was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions: Pay costs. Complete any counseling programs provided by probation agent. Contact with victim is as allowed by probation agent.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deke D. Miller in court with attorney Thomas J Kelly. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Forehand states there's a joint recommendation, the State will dismiss count 1 and amend Count 2 to disorderly conduct and strike out the domestic abuse modifier with 1 year probation. Def pleads NC to Count 2. Plea colloquy on record. Findings of guilt, court finds def guilty. Atty Forehand addresses the court and asks the court to accept the joint recommendation. 
Court orders: Sentence withheld, 1 year probation.
Conditions: Def must complete any counseling programs provided by probation agent.  Contact with victim is as allowed by probation agent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Thomas J Kelly in court for Defendant Deke D. Miller. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kelly states that they received an offer today, asking for a status be set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on February 7, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

2:24 p.m.  Attorney Thomas J Kelly in court, by authorization, for Defendant Deke D. Miller. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Deke D. Miller not in court. Court states the charges and informs defense of the possible max. penalties.  Atty. K enters NG pleas on def's behalf.  Court finds probable cause and sets status to allow for discovery exchange and completion.  Atty. K states discovery has already been received.  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 28, 2016 at 02:20 pm.
of Judge - approved by Judge Sharp 11/16/16
